title: The Treasury Department Could Introduce a 50-Year Bond
text:
The U.S. Treasury Department named three options for potential new securities in its latest financing report. Notably, one of them is a 50-year bond.

In its quarterly refunding statement, the Treasury said it was “exploring a range of possible new products” including 50-year and 20-year bonds. It is also looking at a one-year note with a floating rate based on the chosen replacement for Libor, daily London interbank offered rate. Wall Street had expected the Treasury to mention a 20-year bond and/or floating-rate note in Wednesday’s...
description: In its quarterly refunding statement, the Treasury said it was “exploring a range of possible new products” including 50-year and 20-year bonds.
